column5: I think I'm addicted to poles! HH
Out of the Brass Rail and back to work Bud ...
Your right Wayne, the ballet is a very special place! HH
Yes very addictive for me . So much work not getting done around my house OFC did it to me.  What a great family I have met alot of great folks here I look forward to more years to come.  MTP

for me it depends on the day.  I work like 70hours a week so its nice to check in on here and see whats happening to get away form the stress of work.  I have a 2 year old son so most of the weekends are spent with him and the misses.  I tend to be on here way more in the summer reading the reports being envious of all you who get to fish 30x more then i do.  I have been a member here for 3 or 4 years now so i think it is very addicting.  Of all the sites i have signed up for over the years this one is the only one i have contiunued to be active in.  There are way worse things to be addicted to lol  Cheers!

Check it pretty much every day when I get home from work, and before bed, and sometimes before work, but I stay away while at work...Thought about it though LOL!  Prolly cut down once the nice weather is here though

check it a couple times a day (but dont always log in) in the winter, summer i can go a week without, wonder why?  CABIN FEVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  not able to at work (good thing) we only have a handfull of websites our IT dept. let's us peruse, mostly work related, I can only check the weather network so many times, CBC, local paper, rest is work related,

Totally addicted.  I check it out at work, if I'm not too busy of course.  The chat feature cannot be accessed from my work terminal, for the better I suppose.  I can admit my problem, and I'm fine with that.  reefrunner

This is too funny !!!!!...sorry i mean addictive.  ....can i buy a jumla,why do i need a jumla ??..LOL..LOL.   of course its addicting,it was meant to be that way.  ..im in for the long haul,man...wanna go fishin!!!!!

This place is really addictive. I bring my laptop into the bathroom with me when I take a dump just so I don't miss a post in real time! God bless wireless internet. I'm hooked!  </end sarcasm>  But seriously, the OP is bang-on. This site does have some addictive properties. I'm an OFNer!
OFNA - The silent disease    Ontario Fishing Network Addiction     It's real and it's spreading. Just how bad is it? What can we do to stop it?
I couldn't tell you in minutes or hours per day SNAG, but I've been hanging around here for about 6 years or so, so ya, I guess you could say this place is addictive
comes and goes  can go for days without and othe times get the shakes if I havn't checked within the hour. dam OFC  tb
Couple years ago I remember thinking: Sure is nice to see Lew greeting everyone at 5am.  That's addictive!

Hmmm...I chose hours...only because of work though...it's just to handy to log in...LOL.  At home, I don't check nearly as often...that's why Monday to Friday I post the most...and barely at all on the weekends.  I see it more like checking to see how family is doing...mind you, I don't keep in touch with them as much as I log in here though.  I wonder if their phone numbers are up to date in my address book....  Think I need an intervention....is there a support group out there?? And don't say OFC Chat....LOL.

Of course it's addictive.  I know that some workplaces block sites like this, but thank goodness the MotherCorp is not yet one of them.  I do appreciate that they don't allow the Java applet that would let me chat at work.  That would be a disaster.

I'm using checking things out every morning before work and again in the evenings.   I even tried to access the site from work.  With the way the network guys have things locked out ... I was really surprised it was able to get in.   I may peek a little a time or two a day ... but won't risk my job over it.  But Hey - If I get fired, that's just more time to be on the board ... right ?
Hell I waive my boss over to show him some of the stuff on here!
I can't afford drugs..so this is the next best thing!

Been around this site for about 5 years now.  Unfortunately, with lots of other commitments, only get a few minutes a day most times.  Almost always find something entertaining or moving to read though...keeps me coming back!  A real sense of family, especially after making it out to a couple of Lakairs, swills, and unfortunately, funerals.
I don't think it's addictive at all and I can stop any time I want... I just don't feel like stopping right now...
Defenetely some kind of addictive attraction going on here.....It was once said that TJ some how runs subliminal messages behind the main screen while you gaze into your monitor.....

Come on...TJ isn't smart enough (buy Jumlas) for that is he?  I mean, after all (buy Jumlas), he's just a northern hick who (buy Jumlas) has nothing better to do with his time (buy Jumlas) than run a fishing network.  I for one (buy Jumlas) don't believe a word of that. He wouldn't insert messages (buy Jumlas) like that would he?  For some reason I feel the need to check out Avery's website to buy some Jumlas.....
Mind meld!  I was going to drop $10,000 on Jumlas!
While my wife thinks I've lost it for spending so much time here, I think she's glad that she doesn't hear "click, click, click, click,click, click," anymore every time she comes up stairs.

HAHAH..  Hey they're having a sale on lucky craft baits apparently!  approx 12 dollars a bait.  that means you could stock up on top water sammies!  mmmmm sammies  OFC..  I need it..  I wanna make a phrunky concoction of it and stick it to my veins..!!  thanx budday HD
When asked by Sugarpacket if I'd ever take a desk job, my answer was:  "Yeah, but I'd be fired within the first few hours for just sitting there on OFC all day"
LOL I have a doctor`s excuse?  I can`t get out like I used too, it helps me keep what little sanity I have left?  Just nice to see people out there that still love and enjoy the sport!

Being somewhat knowledgable of addictions (smoking, booze, fast women and slow horses) I have to say yes, OFC is an addiction...  It's not all bad though...I joined in the summer of 2002 and since have met a bunch of swell people...some at meet and greets, some on fishing trips, some at my home and some at theirs and a lot of others just on-line who I hope to meet face-to-face someday...  How much time do I spend here?...Probably too much...Does the Betty Ford Clinic have a program for OFC addiction ???

I resent that (buy jumlas)  anyone would insinuate (buy jumlas) that I would in any way (buy jumlas) use this fine forum (buy jumlas) to market any fishing product or services. http://www.averystackle.com  That would be unacceptable...   buy jumlas.... (Avery's on March break and is bored by now..)  .... and ,..... um.... minutes for me....
Minutes for me too. I'm logged in most of the day M-F.............post when I have something semi intelligent to add, which is not too often.
Why let that stop you... its doesn't stop anyone else!!!

Mr Beans . Iam totaly in agreement with you on this addiction OFC  I have done it all also .Booze ,wild women  and such. But this site has become more important than my email.I have met a few guys through this site and belive though I havent met in person I can honestly say that they are a great bunch of fisherpeople (ladies included). I haven't gone the site to introduce myself yet as I cannot compose a introduction.I love watching old cronz on sundays and can remember old Red Fisher from the old days.All I can say for sure that I will follow this site an contribute now and then .Great site and hope it can go for many years . Steve   :
Pusher.  You and the rest of you MODerating our rations.
Some one finally gets it!!
